content.webTitle: Britain is sixth best place for business, says survey

fields.headline: Britain is sixth best place for business, says survey
fields.bodyText: Deloitte & Touche, the accountants, publishes a competitiveness index today to coincide with the start of the CBI Conference. Based on indicators such as macroeconomic conditions, innovation, tax and regulation, the index ranks Britain sixth out of 26 countries as places to do business. The US is top, with a report from Deloitte drawing attention to the 3.2% of American GDP invested in research and development. Sweden, Finland and Denmark follow closely, with Germany fifth. Britain is praised for economic stability and enterprise, but falls down on tax and regulation.
